register.name: CONSET
register.description: I2C Control Set Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is set. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: AA
field.description: Assert acknowledge flag.

field.name: SI
field.description: I2C interrupt flag.

field.name: STO
field.description: STOP flag.

field.name: STA
field.description: START flag.

field.name: I2EN
field.description: I2C interface enable.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: STAT
register.description: I2C Status Register. During I2C operation, this register provides detailed status codes that allow software to determine the next action needed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: These bits are unused and are always 0.

field.name: Status
field.description: These bits give the actual status information about the I2C interface.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: DAT
register.description: I2C Data Register. During master or slave transmit mode, data to be transmitted is written to this register. During master or slave receive mode, data that has been received may be read from this register.

field.name: Data
field.description: This register holds data values that have been received or are to be transmitted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: ADR0
register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 0. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

field.name: GC
field.description: General Call enable bit.

field.name: Address
field.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: SCLH
register.description: SCH Duty Cycle Register High Half Word. Determines the high time of the I2C clock.

field.name: SCLH
field.description: Count for SCL HIGH time period selection.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: SCLL
register.description: SCL Duty Cycle Register Low Half Word. Determines the low time of the I2C clock. I2nSCLL and I2nSCLH together determine the clock frequency generated by an I2C master and certain times used in slave mode.

field.name: SCLL
field.description: Count for SCL low time period selection.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: CONCLR
register.description: I2C Control Clear Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is cleared. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: AAC
field.description: Assert acknowledge Clear bit.

field.name: SIC
field.description: I2C interrupt Clear bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: STAC
field.description: START flag Clear bit.

field.name: I2ENC
field.description: I2C interface Disable bit.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: MMCTRL
register.description: Monitor mode control register.

field.name: MM_ENA
field.description: Monitor mode enable.

enumeratedValue.name: THE_I2C_MODULE_WILL_
enumeratedValue.description: The I2C module will enter monitor mode. In this mode the SDA output will be forced high. This will prevent the I2C module from outputting data of any kind (including ACK) onto the I 2C data bus. Depending on the state of the ENA_SCL bit, the output may be also forced high, preventing the module from having control over the I2C clock line.

field.name: ENA_SCL
field.description: SCL output enable.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: When this bit is cleared to 0, the SCL output will be forced high when the module is in monitor mode. As described above, this will prevent the module from having any control over the I2C clock line.

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL
enumeratedValue.description: When this bit is set, the I2C module may exercise the same control over the clock line that it would in normal operation. This means that, acting as a slave peripheral, the I2C module can stretch the clock line (hold it low) until it has had time to respond to an I2C interrupt.[1]

field.name: MATCH_ALL
field.description: Select interrupt register match.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: When this bit is cleared, an interrupt will only be generated when a match occurs to one of the (up-to) four address registers described above. That is, the module will respond as a normal slave as far as address-recognition is concerned.

enumeratedValue.name: ANYADDRESS
enumeratedValue.description: When this bit is set to 1 and the I2C is in monitor mode, an interrupt will be generated on ANY address received. This will enable the part to monitor all traffic on the bus.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is not defined.

register.name: ADR%s
register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

field.name: GC
field.description: General Call enable bit.

field.name: Address
field.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: DATA_BUFFER
register.description: Data buffer register. The contents of the 8 MSBs of the I2DAT shift register will be transferred to the DATA_BUFFER automatically after every nine bits (8 bits of data plus ACK or NACK) has been received on the bus.

field.name: Data
field.description: This register holds contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: MASK%s
register.description: I2C Slave address mask register. This mask register is associated with I2ADR0 to determine an address match. The mask register has no effect when comparing to the General Call address (0000000).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

field.name: MASK
field.description: Mask bits.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is undefined.

register.name: MOD
register.description: Watchdog mode register. This register contains the basic mode and status of the Watchdog Timer.

field.name: WDEN
field.description: Watchdog enable bit. Once this bit has been written with a 1 it cannot be rewritten with a 0.

field.name: WDRESET
field.description: Watchdog reset enable bit. Once this bit has been written with a 1 it cannot be rewritten with a 0.

enumeratedValue.name: INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: A watchdog timeout will not cause a chip reset.

enumeratedValue.name: RESET
enumeratedValue.description: A watchdog timeout will cause a chip reset.

field.name: WDTOF
field.description: Watchdog time-out flag. Set when the watchdog timer times out, by a feed error, or by events associated with WDPROTECT. Cleared by software. Causes a chip reset if WDRESET = 1.

field.name: WDINT
field.description: Warning interrupt flag. Set when the timer reaches the value in WDWARNINT. Cleared by software.

field.name: WDPROTECT
field.description: Watchdog update mode. This bit can be set once by software and is only cleared by a reset.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: The watchdog time-out value (TC) can be changed at any time.

enumeratedValue.name: LOCKED
enumeratedValue.description: The watchdog time-out value (TC) can be changed only after the counter is below the value of WDWARNINT and WDWINDOW.

field.name: LOCK
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents disabling or powering down the clock source selected by bit 0 of the WDCLKSRC register and also prevents switching to a clock source that is disabled or powered down. This bit can be set once by software and is only cleared by any reset. If this bit is one and the WWDT clock source is the IRC when Deep-sleep or Power-down modes are entered, the IRC remains running thereby increasing power consumption in Deep-sleep mode and potentially preventing the part of entering Power-down mode correctly (see Section 15.7).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: TC
register.description: Watchdog timer constant register. This 24-bit register determines the time-out value.

field.name: COUNT
field.description: Watchdog time-out value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: FEED
register.description: Watchdog feed sequence register. Writing 0xAA followed by 0x55 to this register reloads the Watchdog timer with the value contained in WDTC.

field.name: FEED
field.description: Feed value should be 0xAA followed by 0x55.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: TV
register.description: Watchdog timer value register. This 24-bit register reads out the current value of the Watchdog timer.

field.name: COUNT
field.description: Counter timer value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: CLKSEL
register.description: Watchdog clock select register.

field.name: CLKSEL
field.description: Selects source of WDT clock

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: LOCK
field.description: If this bit is set to one writing to this register does not affect bit 0. The clock source can only be changed by first clearing this bit, then writing the new value of bit 0.

register.name: WARNINT
register.description: Watchdog Warning Interrupt compare value.

field.name: WARNINT
field.description: Watchdog warning interrupt compare value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: WINDOW
register.description: Watchdog Window compare value.

field.name: WINDOW
field.description: Watchdog window value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: RBR
register.description: Receiver Buffer Register. Contains the next received character to be read. (DLAB=0)

field.name: RBR
field.description: The USART Receiver Buffer Register contains the oldest received byte in the USART RX FIFO.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: THR
register.description: Transmit Holding Register. The next character to be transmitted is written here. (DLAB=0)

field.name: THR
field.description: Writing to the USART Transmit Holding Register causes the data to be stored in the USART transmit FIFO. The byte will be sent when it is the oldest byte in the FIFO and the transmitter is available.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: DLL
register.description: Divisor Latch LSB. Least significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider. (DLAB=1)

field.name: DLLSB
field.description: The USART Divisor Latch LSB Register, along with the DLM register, determines the baud rate of the USART.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: DLM
register.description: Divisor Latch MSB. Most significant byte of the baud rate divisor value. The full divisor is used to generate a baud rate from the fractional rate divider. (DLAB=1)

field.name: DLMSB
field.description: The USART Divisor Latch MSB Register, along with the DLL register, determines the baud rate of the USART.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: IER
register.description: Interrupt Enable Register. Contains individual interrupt enable bits for the 7 potential USART interrupts. (DLAB=0)

field.name: RBRINTEN
field.description: RBR Interrupt Enable. Enables the Receive Data Available interrupt. It also controls the Character Receive Time-out interrupt.

field.name: THREINTEN
field.description: THRE Interrupt Enable. Enables the THRE interrupt. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[5].

field.name: RLSINTEN
field.description: Enables the Receive Line Status interrupt. The status of this interrupt can be read from LSR[4:1].

field.name: MSINTEN
field.description: Enables the Modem Status interrupt. The components of this interrupt can be read from the MSR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: ABEOINTEN
field.description: Enables the end of auto-baud interrupt.

field.name: ABTOINTEN
field.description: Enables the auto-baud time-out interrupt.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: IIR
register.description: Interrupt ID Register. Identifies which interrupt(s) are pending.

field.name: INTSTATUS
field.description: Interrupt status. Note that IIR[0] is active low. The pending interrupt can be determined by evaluating IIR[3:1].

enumeratedValue.name: AT_LEAST_ONE_INTERRU
enumeratedValue.description: At least one interrupt is pending.

field.name: INTID
field.description: Interrupt identification. IER[3:1] identifies an interrupt corresponding to the USART Rx FIFO. All other values of IER[3:1] not listed below are reserved.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: FIFOEN
field.description: These bits are equivalent to FCR[0].

field.name: ABEOINT
field.description: End of auto-baud interrupt. True if auto-baud has finished successfully and interrupt is enabled.

field.name: ABTOINT
field.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt. True if auto-baud has timed out and interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: FCR
register.description: FIFO Control Register. Controls USART FIFO usage and modes.

field.name: FIFOEN
field.description: FIFO enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: USART FIFOs are disabled. Must not be used in the application.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Active high enable for both USART Rx and TX FIFOs and FCR[7:1] access. This bit must be set for proper USART operation. Any transition on this bit will automatically clear the USART FIFOs.

field.name: RXFIFORES
field.description: RX FIFO Reset

enumeratedValue.name: NO_IMPACT
enumeratedValue.description: No impact on either of USART FIFOs.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[1] will clear all bytes in USART Rx FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

field.name: TXFIFORES
field.description: TX FIFO Reset

enumeratedValue.name: NO_IMPACT
enumeratedValue.description: No impact on either of USART FIFOs.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Writing a logic 1 to FCR[2] will clear all bytes in USART TX FIFO, reset the pointer logic. This bit is self-clearing.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RXTL
field.description: RX Trigger Level. These two bits determine how many receiver USART FIFO characters must be written before an interrupt is activated.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: LCR
register.description: Line Control Register. Contains controls for frame formatting and break generation.

field.name: WLS
field.description: Word Length Select

field.name: SBS
field.description: Stop Bit Select

field.name: PE
field.description: Parity Enable

field.name: PS
field.description: Parity Select

enumeratedValue.name: ODD_PARITY_NUMBER_O
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be odd.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN_PARITY_NUMBER_
enumeratedValue.description: Even Parity. Number of 1s in the transmitted character and the attached parity bit will be even.

field.name: BC
field.description: Break Control

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLE_BREAK_TRANSMI
enumeratedValue.description: Enable break transmission. Output pin USART TXD is forced to logic 0 when LCR[6] is active high.

field.name: DLAB
field.description: Divisor Latch Access Bit

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: MCR
register.description: Modem Control Register.

field.name: DTRCTRL
field.description: Source for modem output pin DTR. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

field.name: RTSCTRL
field.description: Source for modem output pin RTS. This bit reads as 0 when modem loopback mode is active.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: LMS
field.description: Loopback Mode Select. The modem loopback mode provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing. Serial data from the transmitter is connected internally to serial input of the receiver. Input pin, RXD, has no effect on loopback and output pin, TXD is held in marking state. The DSR, CTS, DCD, and RI pins are ignored. Externally, DTR and RTS are set inactive. Internally, the upper four bits of the MSR are driven by the lower four bits of the MCR. This permits modem status interrupts to be generated in loopback mode by writing the lower four bits of MCR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: RTSEN
field.description: RTS enable

field.name: CTSEN
field.description: CTS enable

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: LSR
register.description: Line Status Register. Contains flags for transmit and receive status, including line errors.

field.name: RDR
field.description: Receiver Data Ready:LSR[0] is set when the RBR holds an unread character and is cleared when the USART RBR FIFO is empty.

field.name: OE
field.description: Overrun Error. The overrun error condition is set as soon as it occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[1]. LSR[1] is set when USART RSR has a new character assembled and the USART RBR FIFO is full. In this case, the USART RBR FIFO will not be overwritten and the character in the USART RSR will be lost.

field.name: PE
field.description: Parity Error. When the parity bit of a received character is in the wrong state, a parity error occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[2]. Time of parity error detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: A parity error is associated with the character at the top of the USART RBR FIFO.

field.name: FE
field.description: Framing Error. When the stop bit of a received character is a logic 0, a framing error occurs. A LSR read clears LSR[3]. The time of the framing error detection is dependent on FCR0. Upon detection of a framing error, the RX will attempt to re-synchronize to the data and assume that the bad stop bit is actually an early start bit. However, it cannot be assumed that the next received byte will be correct even if there is no Framing Error. Note: A framing error is associated with the character at the top of the USART RBR FIFO.

field.name: BI
field.description: Break Interrupt. When RXD1 is held in the spacing state (all zeros) for one full character transmission (start, data, parity, stop), a break interrupt occurs. Once the break condition has been detected, the receiver goes idle until RXD1 goes to marking state (all ones). A LSR read clears this status bit. The time of break detection is dependent on FCR[0]. Note: The break interrupt is associated with the character at the top of the USART RBR FIFO.

field.name: THRE
field.description: Transmitter Holding Register Empty. THRE is set immediately upon detection of an empty USART THR and is cleared on a THR write.

field.name: TEMT
field.description: Transmitter Empty. TEMT is set when both THR and TSR are empty; TEMT is cleared when either the TSR or the THR contain valid data.

enumeratedValue.name: VALID_D
enumeratedValue.description: THR and/or the TSR contains valid data.

enumeratedValue.name: EMPTY
enumeratedValue.description: THR and the TSR are empty.

field.name: RXFE
field.description: Error in RX FIFO. LSR[7] is set when a character with a RX error such as framing error, parity error or break interrupt, is loaded into the RBR. This bit is cleared when the LSR register is read and there are no subsequent errors in the USART FIFO.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_ERROR
enumeratedValue.description: RBR contains no USART RX errors or FCR[0]=0.

enumeratedValue.name: ERRO
enumeratedValue.description: USART RBR contains at least one USART RX error.

field.name: TXERR
field.description: Tx Error. In smart card T=0 operation, this bit is set when the smart card has NACKed a transmitted character, one more than the number of times indicated by the TXRETRY field.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: MSR
register.description: Modem Status Register.

field.name: DCTS
field.description: Delta CTS. Set upon state change of input CTS. Cleared on an MSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
enumeratedValue.description: No change detected on modem input, CTS.

enumeratedValue.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
enumeratedValue.description: State change detected on modem input, CTS.

field.name: DDSR
field.description: Delta DSR. Set upon state change of input DSR. Cleared on an MSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
enumeratedValue.description: No change detected on modem input, DSR.

enumeratedValue.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
enumeratedValue.description: State change detected on modem input, DSR.

field.name: TERI
field.description: Trailing Edge RI. Set upon low to high transition of input RI. Cleared on an MSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
enumeratedValue.description: No change detected on modem input, RI.

field.name: DDCD
field.description: Delta DCD. Set upon state change of input DCD. Cleared on an MSR read.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_CHANGE_DETECTED_O
enumeratedValue.description: No change detected on modem input, DCD.

enumeratedValue.name: STATE_CHANGE_DETECTE
enumeratedValue.description: State change detected on modem input, DCD.

field.name: CTS
field.description: Clear To Send State. Complement of input signal CTS. This bit is connected to MCR[1] in modem loopback mode.

field.name: DSR
field.description: Data Set Ready State. Complement of input signal DSR. This bit is connected to MCR[0] in modem loopback mode.

field.name: RI
field.description: Ring Indicator State. Complement of input RI. This bit is connected to MCR[2] in modem loopback mode.

field.name: DCD
field.description: Data Carrier Detect State. Complement of input DCD. This bit is connected to MCR[3] in modem loopback mode.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: SCR
register.description: Scratch Pad Register. Eight-bit temporary storage for software.

field.name: PAD
field.description: A readable, writable byte.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: ACR
register.description: Auto-baud Control Register. Contains controls for the auto-baud feature.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_BAUD_START_AUT
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-baud start (auto-baud is running). Auto-baud run bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Auto-baud mode select bit.

field.name: AUTORESTART
field.description: Start mode

enumeratedValue.name: RESTART_IN_CASE_OF_T
enumeratedValue.description: Restart in case of time-out (counter restarts at next USART Rx falling edge)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: ABEOINTCLR
field.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear bit (write only accessible).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

field.name: ABTOINTCLR
field.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt clear bit (write only accessible).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: ICR
register.description: IrDA Control Register. Enables and configures the IrDA (remote control) mode.

field.name: IRDAEN
field.description: IrDA mode enable

enumeratedValue.name: IRDA_MODE_IS_DISABLE
enumeratedValue.description: IrDA mode is disabled, USARTn acts as a standard USART.

field.name: IRDAINV
field.description: Serial input inverter

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: The serial input is not inverted.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: The serial input is inverted. This has no effect on the serial output.

field.name: FIXPULSEEN
field.description: IrDA fixed pulse width mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: IrDA fixed pulse width mode disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: IrDA fixed pulse width mode enabled.

field.name: PULSEDIV
field.description: Configures the pulse width when FixPulseEn = 1.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: FDR
register.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

field.name: DIVADDVAL
field.description: Baud rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud rate generator will not impact the USART baud rate.

field.name: MULVAL
field.description: Baud rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for USART to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud rate generator is used or not.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: OSR
register.description: Oversampling Register. Controls the degree of oversampling during each bit time.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: OSFRAC
field.description: Fractional part of the oversampling ratio, in units of 1/8th of an input clock period. (001 = 0.125, ..., 111 = 0.875)

field.name: OSINT
field.description: Integer part of the oversampling ratio, minus 1. The reset values equate to the normal operating mode of 16 input clocks per bit time.

field.name: FDINT
field.description: In Smart Card mode, these bits act as a more-significant extension of the OSint field, allowing an oversampling ratio up to 2048 as required by ISO7816-3. In Smart Card mode, bits 14:4 should initially be set to 371, yielding an oversampling ratio of 372.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: TER
register.description: Transmit Enable Register. Turns off USART transmitter for use with software flow control.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: TXEN
field.description: When this bit is 1, as it is after a Reset, data written to the THR is output on the TXD pin as soon as any preceding data has been sent. If this bit cleared to 0 while a character is being sent, the transmission of that character is completed, but no further characters are sent until this bit is set again. In other words, a 0 in this bit blocks the transfer of characters from the THR or TX FIFO into the transmit shift register. Software can clear this bit when it detects that the a hardware-handshaking TX-permit signal (CTS) has gone false, or with software handshaking, when it receives an XOFF character (DC3). Software can set this bit again when it detects that the TX-permit signal has gone true, or when it receives an XON (DC1) character.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: HDEN
register.description: Half duplex enable register.

field.name: HDEN
field.description: Half-duplex mode enable

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: SCICTRL
register.description: Smart Card Interface Control register. Enables and configures the Smart Card Interface feature.

field.name: SCIEN
field.description: Smart Card Interface Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: ASYNCHRONOUS_HALF_DU
enumeratedValue.description: Asynchronous half duplex smart card interface is enabled.

field.name: NACKDIS
field.description: NACK response disable. Only applicable in T=0.

field.name: PROTSEL
field.description: Protocol selection as defined in the ISO7816-3 standard.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: TXRETRY
field.description: When the protocol selection T bit (above) is 0, the field controls the maximum number of retransmissions that the USART will attempt if the remote device signals NACK. When NACK has occurred this number of times plus one, the Tx Error bit in the LSR is set, an interrupt is requested if enabled, and the USART is locked until the FIFO is cleared.

field.name: XTRAGUARD
field.description: When the protocol selection T bit (above) is 0, this field indicates the number of bit times (ETUs) by which the guard time after a character transmitted by the USART should exceed the nominal 2 bit times. 0xFF in this field may indicate that there is just a single bit after a character and 11 bit times/character

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: RS485CTRL
register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

field.name: NMMEN
field.description: NMM enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte causes the USART to set the parity error and generate an interrupt.

field.name: RXDIS
field.description: Receiver enable.

field.name: AADEN
field.description: AAD enable.

field.name: SEL
field.description: Select direction control pin

enumeratedValue.name: RTS
enumeratedValue.description: If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin RTS is used for direction control.

enumeratedValue.name: DTR
enumeratedValue.description: If direction control is enabled (bit DCTRL = 1), pin DTR is used for direction control.

field.name: DCTRL
field.description: Auto direction control enable.

field.name: OINV
field.description: Polarity control. This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the RTS (or DTR) pin.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: RS485ADRMATCH
register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

field.name: ADRMATCH
field.description: Contains the address match value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: RS485DLY
register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 direction control delay.

field.name: DLY
field.description: Contains the direction control (RTS or DTR) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: SYNCCTRL
register.description: Synchronous mode control register.

field.name: SYNC
field.description: Enables synchronous mode.

field.name: CSRC
field.description: Clock source select.

field.name: FES
field.description: Falling edge sampling.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING
enumeratedValue.description: RxD is sampled on the rising edge of SCLK

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: RxD is sampled on the falling edge of SCLK

field.name: TSBYPASS
field.description: Transmit synchronization bypass in synchronous slave mode.

enumeratedValue.name: SYNC
enumeratedValue.description: The input clock is synchronized prior to being used in clock edge detection logic

enumeratedValue.name: NOSYNC
enumeratedValue.description: The input clock is not synchronized prior to being used in clock edge detection logic. This allows for a high er input clock rate at the expense of potential metastability.

field.name: CSCEN
field.description: Continuous master clock enable (used only when CSRC is 1)

enumeratedValue.name: SCLK_CYCLES_ONLY_WHE
enumeratedValue.description: SCLK cycles only when characters are being sent on TxD

enumeratedValue.name: SCLK_RUNS_CONTINUOUS
enumeratedValue.description: SCLK runs continuously (characters can be received on RxD independently from transmission on TxD)

field.name: SSDIS
field.description: Start/stop bits

enumeratedValue.name: SEND
enumeratedValue.description: Send start and stop bits as in other modes.

field.name: CCCLR
field.description: Continuous clock clear

enumeratedValue.name: HARDWARE_CLEARS_CSCE
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware clears CSCEN after each character is received.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: CRST

enumeratedValue.description: The Timer Counter and the Prescale Counter are synchronously reset on the next positive edge of PCLK. The counters remain reset until TCR[1] is returned to zero.

register.name: TC
register.description: Timer Counter. The 16-bit TC is incremented every PR+1 cycles of PCLK. The TC is controlled through the TCR.

field.name: TC
field.description: Timer counter value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: PR
register.description: Prescale Register. When the Prescale Counter (below) is equal to this value, the next clock increments the TC and clears the PC.

field.name: PCVAL
field.description: Prescale value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: PC
register.description: Prescale Counter. The 16-bit PC is a counter which is incremented to the value stored in PR. When the value in PR is reached, the TC is incremented and the PC is cleared. The PC is observable and controllable through the bus interface.

field.name: PC
field.description: Prescale counter value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: MCR
register.description: Match Control Register. The MCR is used to control if an interrupt is generated and if the TC is reset when a Match occurs.

field.description: Interrupt on MR0: an interrupt is generated when MR0 matches the value in the TC.

field.name: MR0R
field.description: Reset on MR0: the TC will be reset if MR0 matches it.

field.name: MR0S

field.name: MR1I

field.name: CAP0RE
field.description: Capture on CT16Bn_CAP0 rising edge: a sequence of 0 then 1 on CT16Bn_CAP0 will cause CR0 to be loaded with the contents of TC.

field.name: CAP0FE

register.name: CR%s

field.name: CAP

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: EMR
register.description: External Match Register. The EMR controls the match function and the external match pins

field.name: EM0
field.description: External Match 0. This bit reflects the state of output CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR0, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[5:4] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

field.name: EM1
field.description: External Match 1. This bit reflects the state of output CT16B0_MAT1/CT16B1_MAT1, whether or not this output is connected to its pin. When a match occurs between the TC and MR1, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[7:6] control the functionality of this output. This bit is driven to the CT16B0_MAT0/CT16B1_MAT0 pins if the match function is selected in the IOCON registers (0 = LOW, 1 = HIGH).

field.name: EM2
field.description: External Match 2. This bit reflects the state of match channel 2. When a match occurs between the TC and MR2, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[9:8] control the functionality of this output.

field.name: EM3
field.description: External Match 3. This bit reflects the state of output of match channel 3. When a match occurs between the TC and MR3, this bit can either toggle, go LOW, go HIGH, or do nothing. Bits EMR[11:10] control the functionality of this output.

field.name: EMC0
field.description: External Match Control 0. Determines the functionality of External Match 0. Table 238 shows the encoding of these bits.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
enumeratedValue.description: Clear the corresponding External Match bit/output to 0 (CT16Bi_MAT0 pin is LOW if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
enumeratedValue.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT16Bi_MAT0 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC1

register.name: CTCR
register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

field.name: CTM
field.description: Counter/Timer Mode. This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR, bits 2:0 in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

enumeratedValue.name: BOTH_EDGES
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

field.name: CIS
field.description: Count Input Select. In counter mode (when bits 1:0 in this register are not 00), these bits select which CAP pin or comparator output is sampled for clocking. Values 0x1 to 0x3 are reserved.

field.name: ENCC
field.description: Setting this bit to 1 enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

field.name: SELCC
field.description: When bit 4 is a 1, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is low. Values 0x2 to 0x7 are reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CAP0_
enumeratedValue.description: Rising Edge of CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CAP0
enumeratedValue.description: Falling Edge of CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

enumeratedValue.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC1

enumeratedValue.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
enumeratedValue.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT32Bi_MAT1 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON
enumeratedValue.description: Toggle the corresponding External Match bit/output.

field.name: EMC2

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND

enumeratedValue.name: SET_THE_CORRESPONDIN
enumeratedValue.description: Set the corresponding External Match bit/output to 1 (CT32Bi_MAT2 pin is HIGH if pinned out).

enumeratedValue.name: TOGGLE_THE_CORRESPON

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: CTCR
register.description: Count Control Register. The CTCR selects between Timer and Counter mode, and in Counter mode selects the signal and edge(s) for counting.

field.name: CTM
field.description: Counter/Timer Mode. This field selects which rising PCLK edges can increment Timer's Prescale Counter (PC), or clear PC and increment Timer Counter (TC). If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR, bits 2:0 in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000.

enumeratedValue.name: TIMER_MODE_EVERY_RI
enumeratedValue.description: Timer Mode: every rising PCLK edge

enumeratedValue.name: RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on rising edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on falling edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

enumeratedValue.name: BOTHEDGES
enumeratedValue.description: Counter Mode: TC is incremented on both edges on the CAP input selected by bits 3:2.

field.name: CIS
field.description: Count Input Select. In counter mode (when bits 1:0 in this register are not 00), these bits select which CAP pin or comparator output is sampled for clocking. If Counter mode is selected in the CTCR, the 3 bits for that input in the Capture Control Register (CCR) must be programmed as 000. Values 0x2 to 0x3 are reserved.

field.name: ENCC
field.description: Setting this bit to 1 enables clearing of the timer and the prescaler when the capture-edge event specified in bits 7:5 occurs.

field.name: SElCC
field.description: When bit 4 is a 1, these bits select which capture input edge will cause the timer and prescaler to be cleared. These bits have no effect when bit 4 is low. Values 0x3 to 0x7 are reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CAP0_
enumeratedValue.description: Rising Edge of CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CAP0
enumeratedValue.description: Falling Edge of CAP0 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE_OF_CAP1_
enumeratedValue.description: Rising Edge of CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE_OF_CAP1
enumeratedValue.description: Falling Edge of CAP1 clears the timer (if bit 4 is set)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: PWMC
register.description: PWM Control Register. The PWMCON enables PWM mode for the external match pins CT32Bn_MAT[3:0].

field.name: PWMEN0
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel0.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
enumeratedValue.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bi_MAT0.

field.name: PWMEN1
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel1.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
enumeratedValue.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bi_MAT1.

field.name: PWMEN2
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel2.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
enumeratedValue.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT32Bi_MAT2.

field.name: PWMEN3
field.description: PWM mode enable for channel3. Note: It is recommended to use match channel 3 to set the PWM cycle.

enumeratedValue.name: PWM_MODE_IS_ENABLED_
enumeratedValue.description: PWM mode is enabled for CT132Bi_MAT3.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: CR
register.description: A/D Control Register. The CR register must be written to select the operating mode before A/D conversion can occur.

field.name: SEL
field.description: Selects which of the AD7:0 pins is (are) to be sampled and converted. Bit 0 selects Pin AD0, bit 1 selects pin AD1,..., and bit 7 selects pin AD7. In software-controlled mode (BURST = 0), only one channel can be selected, i.e. only one of these bits should be 1. In hardware scan mode (BURST = 1), any numbers of channels can be selected, i.e any or all bits can be set to 1. If all bits are 0 (as after Reset) channel 0 is selected automatically.

field.name: CLKDIV
field.description: The APB clock (PCLK) is divided by CLKDIV +1 to produce the clock for the ADC, which should be less than or equal to 4.5 MHz. Typically, software should program the smallest value in this field that yields a clock of 4.5 MHz or slightly less, but in certain cases (such as a high-impedance analog source) a slower clock may be desirable.

field.name: BURST
field.description: Burst mode

enumeratedValue.name: SOFTWARE_CONTROLLED_
enumeratedValue.description: Software-controlled mode: Conversions are software-controlled and require 11 clocks.

enumeratedValue.name: HARDWARE_SCAN_MODE_
enumeratedValue.description: Hardware scan mode: The AD converter does repeated conversions at the rate selected by the CLKS field, scanning (if necessary) through the pins selected by 1s in the SEL field. The first conversion after the start corresponds to the least-significant bit set to 1 in the SEL field, then the next higher bits (pins) set to 1 are scanned if applicable. Repeated conversions can be terminated by clearing this bit, but the conversion in progress when this bit is cleared will be completed. If bit 20 in this register is set (single-burst mode), hardware clears this bit automatically after one set of conversions on all of the selected channels.

field.name: CLKS
field.description: This field selects the number of clocks used for each conversion in Burst mode, and the number of bits of accuracy of the result in the LS bits of ADDR, between 11 clocks (10 bits) and 4 clocks (3 bits).

field.name: SINGLEBURST
field.description: Single-burst mode

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUOUS_BURST
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous. Burst mode can only be terminated via a software write to clear bit 16 in this register.

enumeratedValue.name: SINGLE_BURST
enumeratedValue.description: Single-burst. When the burst mode is selected by writing a 1 to bit 16 in this register, the ADC cycles through a single set of conversions on the selection of channels specified in the SEL field. Once the conversion has been completed on each selected channel, bit 16 is automatically cleared and the conversions stop until a new trigger event occurs.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: START
field.description: When the BURST bit is 0, these bits control whether/when an A/D conversion is started. All other values are reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_START_THIS_VALUE
enumeratedValue.description: No start (this value should be used when clearing PDN to 0).

enumeratedValue.name: START_CONVERSION_WHE
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on ATRG0.

enumeratedValue.name: START_CONVERSION_WHE
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on the analog comparator output.

enumeratedValue.name: START_CONVERSION_WHE
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on ATRG1.

enumeratedValue.name: START_CONVERSION_WHE
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT32B0_MAT0[1].

enumeratedValue.name: START_CONVERSION_WHE
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT32B0_MAT1[1].

enumeratedValue.name: START_CONVERSION_WHE
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT16B0_MAT0[1].

enumeratedValue.name: START_CONVERSION_WHE
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion when the edge selected by bit 27 occurs on CT16B0_MAT1[1].

field.name: EDGE
field.description: This bit is significant only when the START field contains 0100-1110. In these cases:

enumeratedValue.name: START_CONVERSION_ON_
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion on a rising edge on the selected signal.

enumeratedValue.name: START_CONVERSION_ON_
enumeratedValue.description: Start conversion on a falling edge on the selected signal.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: GDR
register.description: A/D Global Data Register. Contains the result of the most recent A/D conversion.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeroes.

field.name: V_VREF
field.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin selected by the SEL field, divided by the voltage on the VDD pin. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VSS, while 0x3FF indicates that the voltage on ADn was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREF.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeroes. They allow accumulation of successive A/D values without AND-masking, for at least 256 values without overflow into the CHN field.

field.name: CHN
field.description: These bits contain the channel from which the LS bits were converted.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeroes.

field.name: OVERRUN
field.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the LS bits. In non-FIFO operation, this bit is cleared by reading this register.

field.name: DONE
field.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read and when the ADCR is written. If the ADCR is written while a conversion is still in progress, this bit is set and a new conversion is started.

register.name: SEL
register.description: A/D Select Register. Selects between external pins and internal sources.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Always write zeroes to these bits.

field.name: AD5SEL
field.description: This field selects the source signal for channel 5.

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED_DO_NOT_PRO
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved. Do not program this value.

field.name: AD6SEL
field.description: This field selects the source signal for channel 6.

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED_DO_NOT_PRO
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved. Do not program this value.

field.name: AD7SEL
field.description: This field selects the source signal for channel 7.

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED_DO_NOT_PRO
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved. Do not program this value.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Always write zeroes to these bits.

register.name: STAT
register.description: A/D Status Register. This register contains DONE and OVERRUN flags for all of the A/D channels, as well as the A/D interrupt flag.

field.name: DONE
field.description: These bits mirror the DONE status flags that appear in the result register for each A/D channel.

field.name: OVERRUN
field.description: These bits mirror the OVERRUN status flags that appear in the result register for each A/D channel. Reading ADSTAT allows checking the status of all A/D channels simultaneously.

field.name: ADINT
field.description: This bit is the A/D interrupt flag. It is one when any of the individual A/D channel Done flags is asserted and enabled to contribute to the A/D interrupt via the ADINTEN register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Always 0.

register.name: INTEN
register.description: A/D Interrupt Enable Register. This register contains enable bits that allow the DONE flag of each A/D channel to be included or excluded from contributing to the generation of an A/D interrupt.

field.name: ADINTEN
field.description: These bits allow control over which A/D channels generate interrupts for conversion completion. When bit 0 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 0 will generate an interrupt, when bit 1 is one, completion of a conversion on A/D channel 1 will generate an interrupt, etc.

field.name: ADGINTEN
field.description: When 1, enables the global DONE flag in ADDR to generate an interrupt. When 0, only the individual A/D channels enabled by ADINTEN 7:0 will generate interrupts.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Always 0.

register.name: DR%s
register.description: A/D Channel 0 Data Register. This register contains the result of the most recent conversion completed on channel 0

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeroes.

field.name: V_VREF
field.description: When DONE is 1, this field contains a binary fraction representing the voltage on the ADn pin, divided by the voltage on the VREF pin. Zero in the field indicates that the voltage on the ADn pin was less than, equal to, or close to that on VREF, while 0x3FF indicates that the voltage on AD input was close to, equal to, or greater than that on VREF.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. These bits always read as zeroes. They allow accumulation of successive A/D values without AND-masking for at least 256 values without overflow into the CHN field.

field.name: OVERRUN
field.description: This bit is 1 in burst mode if the results of one or more conversions was (were) lost and overwritten before the conversion that produced the result in the LS bits.This bit is cleared by reading this register.

field.name: DONE
field.description: This bit is set to 1 when an A/D conversion completes. It is cleared when this register is read.

register.name: CR
register.description: D/A control register

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: VALUE
field.description: After the selected settling time after a conversion begins, the voltage on the AOUT pin (with respect to VSS) is VALUE x (V DD/1024).

field.name: BIAS
field.description: Settling time

enumeratedValue.name: FAST
enumeratedValue.description: The settling time of the DAC is 1 us max, and the maximum current is 700 uA. This allows a maximum update rate of 1 MHz.

enumeratedValue.name: SLOW
enumeratedValue.description: The settling time of the DAC is 2.5 us and the maximum current is 350 uA. This allows a maximum update rate of 400 kHz.

field.name: TRIG
field.description: The value written to this field determines whether conversion begins immediately after this register is written, or whether conversion is delayed until a selected event occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: IMMEDIATE
enumeratedValue.description: Conversion begins when this register is written, and AOUT begins to change to the new voltage immediately. For all other values in this field, AOUT remains at its previous voltage until the selected event has occurred.

enumeratedValue.name: COMPLEVELOUT
enumeratedValue.description: Conversion is triggered by the selected edge(s) on the analog comparator (level) output

enumeratedValue.name: ATRG0EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Conversion is triggered by the selected edge(s) on ATRG0.

enumeratedValue.name: ATRG1EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Conversion is triggered by the selected edge(s) on ATRG1.

enumeratedValue.name: CT32B1_MAT0EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Conversion is triggered by the selected edge(s) on CT32B1_MAT0 [2].

enumeratedValue.name: CT32B1_MAT1EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Conversion is triggered by the selected edge(s) on CT32B1_MAT1[2].

enumeratedValue.name: CT16B1_MAT0EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Conversion is triggered by the selected edge(s) on CT16B1_MAT0[2].

enumeratedValue.name: CT16B1_MAT1EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Conversion is triggered by the selected edge(s) on CT16B1_MAT1[2].

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

field.name: EDGESEL
field.description: For non-zero values of TRIG, this field selects when the conversion is triggered:

field.name: TRIGERD
field.description: If the TRIG field (above) is non-zero, this bit is set when a conversion is triggered, and is cleared by any write to this register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: RESERVED
register.description: Reserved

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: CTL
register.description: Comparator control register

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Write as 0.

field.name: EDGESEL
field.description: This field controls which edges on the comparator output set the COMPEDGE bit (bit 23 below): 00 = Falling edges 01 = Rising edges 1x = Both edges

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Write as 0.

field.name: COMPSA
field.description: Comarator output control

enumeratedValue.name: SYNCH
enumeratedValue.description: Synchronizes the comparator output to the bus clock for output to other modules.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Write as 0.

field.name: COMP_VP_SEL
field.description: Selects positive voltage input

field.name: COMP_VM_SEL
field.description: Selects negative voltage input

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Write as 0.

field.name: EDGECLR
field.description: Interrupt clear bit. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the COMPEDGE bit (bit 23 below) and thus negates the interrupt request.

field.name: COMPSTAT
field.description: Comparator status. This bit reflects the state of the comparator output.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Write as 0.

field.name: COMPEDGE
field.description: Comparator edge-detect status.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. Write as 0.

field.name: HYS
field.description: Controls the hysteresis of the comparator. When the comparator is outputting a certain state, this is the difference between the selected signals, in the opposite direction from the state being output, that will switch the output.

enumeratedValue.name: NOHYSTERESIS
enumeratedValue.description: None (the output will switch as the voltages cross)

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: LAD
register.description: Voltage ladder register

field.name: LADEN
field.description: Voltage ladder enable

field.name: LADSEL
field.description: Voltage ladder value. The reference voltage Vref depends on the LADREF bit below. 00000 = VSS 00001 = 1 Vref/31 00010 = 2 Vref/31 ... 11111 = Vref

field.name: LADREF
field.description: Selects the reference voltage for the voltage ladder

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Unused

register.name: EEMSSTART
register.description: EEPROM BIST start address register

field.name: STARTA
field.description: BIST start address: Bit 0 is fixed zero since only even addresses are allowed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: EEMSSTOP
register.description: EEPROM BIST stop address register

field.name: STOPA
field.description: BIST stop address: Bit 0 is fixed zero since only even addresses are allowed.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

field.name: DEVSEL
field.description: BIST device select bit 0: the BIST signature is generated over the total memory space. Singe pages are interleaved over the EEPROM devices when multiple devices are used, the signature is generated over memory of multiple devices. 1: the BIST signature is generated only over a memory range located on a single EEPROM device. Therefore the internal address generation is done such that the address' CS bits are kept stable to select only the same device. The address' MSB and LSB bits are used to step through the memory range specified by the start and stop address fields. Note: if this bit is set the start and stop address fields must be programmed such that they both address the same EEPROM device. Therefore the address' CS bits in both the start and stop address must be the same.

field.name: STRTBIST
field.description: BIST start bit Setting this bit will start the BIST. This bit is self-clearing.

register.name: EEMSSIG
register.description: EEPROM 24-bit BIST signature register

field.name: DATA_SIG
field.description: BIST 16-bit signature calculated from only the data bytes

field.name: PARITY_SIG
field.description: BIST 16-bit signature calculated from only the parity bits of the data bytes

register.name: FLASHCFG
register.description: Flash memory access time configuration register

field.name: FLASHTIM
field.description: Flash memory access time. FLASHTIM +1 is equal to the number of system clocks used for flash access.

enumeratedValue.name: 1_SYSTEM_CLOCK_FLASH
enumeratedValue.description: 1 system clock flash access time (for system clock frequencies of up to 20 MHz).

enumeratedValue.name: 2_SYSTEM_CLOCKS_FLAS
enumeratedValue.description: 2 system clocks flash access time (for system clock frequencies of up to 40 MHz).

enumeratedValue.name: 3_SYSTEM_CLOCKS_FLAS
enumeratedValue.description: 3 system clocks flash access time (for system clock frequencies of up to 50 MHz).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved. User software must not change the value of these bits. Bits 31:2 must be written back exactly as read.

register.name: FMSSTART
register.description: Signature start address register

field.name: START
field.description: Signature generation start address (corresponds to AHB byte address bits[20:4]).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: FMSSTOP
register.description: Signature stop-address register

field.name: STOP
field.description: BIST stop address divided by 16 (corresponds to AHB byte address [20:4]).

field.name: SIG_START
field.description: Start control bit for signature generation.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: SW0_31_0
field.description: Word 0 of 128-bit signature (bits 31 to 0).

field.name: SW1_63_32
field.description: Word 1 of 128-bit signature (bits 63 to 32).

field.name: SW2_95_64
field.description: Word 2 of 128-bit signature (bits 95 to 64).

field.name: SW3_127_96
field.description: Word 3 of 128-bit signature (bits 127 to 96).

register.name: FMSTAT
register.description: Signature generation status register

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: SIG_DONE
field.description: When 1, a previously started signature generation has completed. See FMSTATCLR register description for clearing this flag.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: FMSTATCLR
register.description: Signature generation status clear register

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

field.name: SIG_DONE_CLR
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bits clears the signature generation completion flag (SIG_DONE) in the FMSTAT register.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: CR0
register.description: Control Register 0. Selects the serial clock rate, bus type, and data size.

field.name: DSS
field.description: Data Size Select. This field controls the number of bits transferred in each frame. Values 0000-0010 are not supported and should not be used.

field.name: FRF
field.description: Frame Format.

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED
enumeratedValue.description: This combination is not supported and should not be used.

field.name: CPOL
field.description: Clock Out Polarity. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: SPI controller maintains the bus clock low between frames.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: SPI controller maintains the bus clock high between frames.

field.name: CPHA
field.description: Clock Out Phase. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FIRSTCLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: SPI controller captures serial data on the first clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition away from the inter-frame state of the clock line.

enumeratedValue.name: SECONDCLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: SPI controller captures serial data on the second clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition back to the inter-frame state of the clock line.

field.name: SCR
field.description: Serial Clock Rate. The number of prescaler output clocks per bit on the bus, minus one. Given that CPSDVSR is the prescale divider, and the APB clock PCLK clocks the prescaler, the bit frequency is PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: CR1
register.description: Control Register 1. Selects master/slave and other modes.

field.name: LBM
field.description: Loop Back Mode.

enumeratedValue.name: SERIAL_INPUT_IS_TAKE
enumeratedValue.description: Serial input is taken from the serial output (MOSI or MISO) rather than the serial input pin (MISO or MOSI respectively).

field.name: SSE
field.description: SPI Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The SPI controller will interact with other devices on the serial bus. Software should write the appropriate control information to the other SSP/SPI registers and interrupt controller registers, before setting this bit.

field.name: MS
field.description: Master/Slave Mode.This bit can only be written when the SSE bit is 0.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: The SPI controller acts as a master on the bus, driving the SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines and receiving the MISO line.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE
enumeratedValue.description: The SPI controller acts as a slave on the bus, driving MISO line and receiving SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines.

field.name: SOD
field.description: Slave Output Disable. This bit is relevant only in slave mode (MS = 1). If it is 1, this blocks this SPI controller from driving the transmit data line (MISO).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: DR
register.description: Data Register. Writes fill the transmit FIFO, and reads empty the receive FIFO.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Write: software can write data to be sent in a future frame to this register whenever the TNF bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Tx FIFO is not full. If the Tx FIFO was previously empty and the SPI controller is not busy on the bus, transmission of the data will begin immediately. Otherwise the data written to this register will be sent as soon as all previous data has been sent (and received). If the data length is less than 16 bit, software must right-justify the data written to this register. Read: software can read data from this register whenever the RNE bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Rx FIFO is not empty. When software reads this register, the SPI controller returns data from the least recent frame in the Rx FIFO. If the data length is less than 16 bit, the data is right-justified in this field with higher order bits filled with 0s.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: SR
register.description: Status Register

field.name: TFE
field.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. This bit is 1 is the Transmit FIFO is empty, 0 if not.

field.name: TNF
field.description: Transmit FIFO Not Full. This bit is 0 if the Tx FIFO is full, 1 if not.

field.name: RNE
field.description: Receive FIFO Not Empty. This bit is 0 if the Receive FIFO is empty, 1 if not.

field.name: RFF
field.description: Receive FIFO Full. This bit is 1 if the Receive FIFO is full, 0 if not.

field.name: BSY
field.description: Busy. This bit is 0 if the SPI controller is idle, 1 if it is currently sending/receiving a frame and/or the Tx FIFO is not empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: CPSR
register.description: Clock Prescale Register

field.name: CPSDVSR
field.description: This even value between 2 and 254, by which SPI_PCLK is divided to yield the prescaler output clock. Bit 0 always reads as 0.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved.

register.name: IMSC
register.description: Interrupt Mask Set and Clear Register

field.name: RORIM
field.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Overrun occurs, that is, when the Rx FIFO is full and another frame is completely received. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

field.name: RTIM
field.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Time-out condition occurs. A Receive Time-out occurs when the Rx FIFO is not empty, and no has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

field.name: RXIM
field.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

field.name: TXIM
field.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: RIS
register.description: Raw Interrupt Status Register

field.name: RORRIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

field.name: RTRIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, and has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

field.name: RXRIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

field.name: TXRIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: MIS
register.description: Masked Interrupt Status Register

field.name: RORMIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full, and this interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RTMIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, has not been read for a time-out period, and this interrupt is enabled. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

field.name: RXMIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full, and this interrupt is enabled.

field.name: TXMIS
field.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty, and this interrupt is enabled.

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: ICR
register.description: SSPICR Interrupt Clear Register

field.name: RORIC
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the frame was received when RxFIFO was full interrupt.

field.name: RTIC
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the Rx FIFO was not empty and has not been read for a timeout period interrupt. The timeout period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

register.name: IST
register.description: Pin Interrupt Status register

field.name: PSTAT0
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the PINTENT_F register).

register.name: CTRL
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt control register

field.name: INT
field.description: Group interrupt status. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it. Writing zero has no effect.

field.name: COMB
field.description: Combine enabled inputs for group interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: OR_FUNCTIONALITY_A_
enumeratedValue.description: OR functionality: A grouped interrupt is generated when any one of the enabled inputs is active (based on its programmed polarity).

enumeratedValue.name: AND_FUNCTIONALITY_A
enumeratedValue.description: AND functionality: An interrupt is generated when all enabled bits are active (based on their programmed polarity).

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Group interrupt trigger

field.name: RESERVED
field.description: Reserved

register.name: PORT_POL%s
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 polarity register

field.name: POL_0
field.description: Configure pin polarity of port pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin P0/1_n of port 0/1 . 0 = the pin is active LOW. If the level on this pin is LOW, the pin contributes to the group interrupt. 1 = the pin is active HIGH. If the level on this pin is HIGH, the pin contributes to the group interrupt.

field.name: POL_1
field.description: Configure pin polarity of port 0/1 pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin P0/1_n of port 0/1. 0 = the pin is active LOW. If the level on this pin is LOW, the pin contributes to the group interrupt. 1 = the pin is active HIGH. If the level on this pin is HIGH, the pin contributes to the group interrupt.

field.name: POL_2
field.description: Configure pin polarity of port 0/1 pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin P0/1_n of port 0/1. 0 = the pin is active LOW. register.name: B%s
register.description: Byte pin registers port 0; pins PIO0_0 to PIO0_31

field.name: PBYTE
field.description: Read: state of the pin P0_n, regardless of direction, masking, or alternate function, except that pins configured as analog I/O always read as 0. Write: loads the pin's output bit.

register.name: B%s
register.description: Byte pin registers port 1

field.name: PBYTE
field.description: Read: state of the pin P1_n, regardless of direction, masking, or alternate function, except that pins configured as analog I/O always read as 0. Write: loads the pin's output bit.

register.name: W%s
register.description: Word pin registers port 0

field.name: PWORD
field.description: Read 0: pin is LOW. Write 0: clear output bit. Read 0xFFFF FFFF: pin is HIGH. Write any value 0x0000 0001 to 0xFFFF FFFF: set output bit. Only 0 or 0xFFFF FFFF can be read. Writing any value other than 0 will set the output bit.

register.name: W%s
register.description: Word pin registers port 1

field.name: PWORD
field.description: Read 0: pin is LOW. Write 0: clear output bit. Read 0xFFFF FFFF: pin is HIGH. Write any value 0x0000 0001 to 0xFFFF FFFF: set output bit. Only 0 or 0xFFFF FFFF can be read. Writing any value other than 0 will set the output bit.

register.name: DIR%s
register.description: Direction registers port 0/1

field.name: DIRP0
field.description: Selects pin direction for pin P0/1_n (bit 0 = P0/1_0, bit 1 = P0_1, ..., bit 31 = P0/1_31). 0 = input. 1 = output.

field.name: DIRP1
field.description: Selects pin direction for pin P0/1_n (bit 0 = P0/1_0, bit 1 = P0_1, ..., bit 31 = P0/1_31). 0 = input. 1 = output.

register.name: MPIN%s
register.description: Masked port register port 0/1

field.name: MPORTP0
field.description: Masked port register (bit 0 = P0/1_0, bit 1 = P0/1_1, ..., bit 31 = P0/1_31). 0 = Read: pin is LOW and/or the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 1; write: clear output bit if the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0. 1 = Read: pin is HIGH and the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0; write: set output bit if the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0.
